definition: fault/to blame/to punish/calamity/misfortune
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to put the blame on/to accuse
to admit responsibility and resign
cannot escape censure (idiom)/has to bear the blame
to forget and not bear recriminations (idiom); to let bygones be bygones/There is no point in crying over spilt milk.
to have only oneself to blame (idiom)/to bring trouble through one's own actions
to take the blame/to accept responsibility (for a mistake)
faulted at every turn (idiom); can't get anything right
see 咎由自取[jiu4 you2 zi4 qu3]
not censure sb for his past misdeeds/overlook sb's past mistakes/let bygones be bygones
to take the blame
to deserve what one gets (punishment, mishap etc) (idiom)

sentences.english: Abandon unnecessary guilt. It's extra baggage you don't need to carry.
sentences.chinese: 丢弃无由得愧咎，别让它成为你的沉重包袱。

sentences.english: Wall Streeters and the financial experts are also at fault.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街人和金融专家也其责难咎。

sentences.english: The blame make smell and night cry.

definition: variant of 徇[xun4]
to give in to/to be swayed by (personal considerations etc)/Taiwan pr. [xun2]/to follow/to expose publicly/variant of 侚[xun4]/variant of 殉[xun4]
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
to brag/popular/lovely
official in feudal court/subject
minister not afraid to give forthright criticism
surname Chen
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
see 矯枉過正|矫枉过正[jiao3 wang3 guo4 zheng4]
that being the case/then/in that case
morning and night/always/at all times
quarrel/dispute/a blood sacrifice (arch.)
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
lone/lonely
one-sided words/prejudice/flattery
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
imperial order
to beg
